CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Fair hearing);Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant brought a court action against ORG of GPE ( PERSON социального страхования Российской PERSON ) for compensation of health damage .
CARDINAL . On DATE her claim was dismissed by ORG . The decision was quashed on appeal and the case was remitted for a fresh examination to the same court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the applicant ’s claim and ordered ORG ( i ) to calculate the amount of the lump - sum compensation for the period from DATE to DATE and of the DATE compensation which should be paid from DATE , ( ii ) to pay these amounts to the applicant , and ( iii ) to index - link the DATE payments in future in accordance with national law .
CARDINAL . The judgment was not appealed against and became final on DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicant states that no lump - sum compensation was paid to her .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG calculated the DATE payments due to the applicant as of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the President of ORG lodged with the ORG of that court an application for supervisory review of the judgment of DATE . He also suspended the execution of the judgment pending the supervisory review proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicant that the ORG would examine her case on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the judgment of DATE stating that the first instance court had incorrectly applied domestic law : the lump - sum compensation should have been calculated from DATE and not DATE . The case was remitted for a fresh examination to the first instance court .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s claim .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment .
